name: AI & Machine Learning Research
description: High-precision filter for substantive AI/ML research: peer-reviewed papers, preprints, novel architectures, training techniques, evaluation methods, benchmark results, and major open-source/model/dataset releases with technical detail. Excludes beginner Q&A, generic AI news, product marketing, job posts, and non-technical commentary.
positive_samples: New arXiv preprint introduces a sparse mixture-of-experts transformer achieving 35% lower FLOPs at parity on MMLU and GSM8K.
NeurIPS paper proposes a hybrid retrieval-augmented language model that sets a new SOTA on open-domain QA benchmarks.
ICLR submission demonstrates a novel attention mechanism that scales to 1M tokens with sub-quadratic complexity.
Open-source LLM release: 70B parameter model surpasses prior open models on MT-Bench and MMLU with fully reproducible training recipe.
Research team presents a new optimizer that reduces training instability in very deep transformers by 20% on held-out benchmarks.
Paper shows a systematic study of scaling laws for multimodal models, predicting performance at 10x current compute budgets.
New diffusion model architecture achieves state-of-the-art FID and CLIPScore on multiple image generation benchmarks.
Benchmark report: novel reasoning-focused evaluation suite exposes failures of existing LLMs on multi-step arithmetic tasks.
Robotics paper demonstrates end-to-end visuomotor policies trained via RL that outperform classical controllers on manipulation tasks.
New dataset of 1T tokens with detailed documentation is released for large-scale language model pretraining.
Study introduces a unified framework for instruction tuning that improves zero-shot generalization across 20 downstream tasks.
Paper shows large gains from curriculum learning in code generation models, with new SOTA on HumanEval and MBPP.
Conference talk: scalable RLHF pipeline for alignment of frontier-scale LLMs, including ablations on reward model design.
Research release: multimodal transformer achieving SOTA on image captioning and VQA while using fewer parameters.
Paper on low-rank adaptation (LoRA) techniques shows how to fine-tune 100B+ models efficiently with strong downstream performance.
Study introduces a new testbed for evaluation of tool-use by language models, including code execution and web browsing tasks.
Benchmarking paper provides a comprehensive comparison of open-source LLMs on safety, robustness, and reasoning metrics.
Research group releases a new instruction-following dataset with detailed annotation guidelines and open license.
Paper demonstrates that long-context training via segment-wise recurrence can extend context windows to 1M tokens without instability.
Novel encoder-decoder architecture achieves SOTA on speech recognition benchmarks while reducing latency by 30%.
New probabilistic diffusion-transformer hybrid model improves sample quality and diversity on text-to-image tasks.
Paper proposes a unified framework for multilingual evaluation of LLMs, revealing large gaps in low-resource languages.
Study rigorously analyzes catastrophic forgetting in continual learning for language models and proposes a mitigation method.
Conference paper shows how retrieval-augmented training improves factuality and reduces hallucination on knowledge-intensive tasks.
New open benchmark for code-understanding LLMs introduces adversarially-designed problems to test robustness.
Paper introduces a scalable method for structured pruning in transformers that preserves accuracy while halving inference cost.
Research on test-time compute scaling demonstrates improved reasoning when dynamically allocating more steps on hard examples.
New RL algorithm for offline policy optimization outperforms prior methods on standard locomotion benchmarks.
Study evaluates the impact of synthetic data on LLM performance and presents a principled data filtering pipeline.
Paper presents a new architecture for video understanding that integrates temporal attention and achieves SOTA on Kinetics.
Research release: open-source evaluation harness for LLMs supporting dozens of tasks, with standardized metrics.
New paper on interpretability introduces a mechanistic analysis of attention heads in large transformers.
Study on safety alignment proposes a scalable oversight mechanism and reports benchmark results on red-teaming datasets.
Paper presents a multi-agent simulation environment for studying emergent cooperation in language-conditioned agents.
Novel gradient compression technique reduces communication overhead in distributed training without degrading accuracy.
Research group releases a massive multilingual speech corpus with detailed phonetic annotations.
Paper shows that combining retrieval with chain-of-thought prompting substantially improves performance on math benchmarks.
New work on knowledge editing in LLMs introduces methods to update specific facts while preserving global behavior.
Study proposes a unified benchmark for evaluating long-term memory in sequence models with contexts up to 500k tokens.
Paper on causal representation learning demonstrates improved generalization on distribution shift benchmarks.
Research introduces a new family of position encodings enabling extrapolation to much longer sequences.
Paper evaluates different RLHF reward models and presents a taxonomy of failure modes observed in practice.
New open-source vision-language model achieves SOTA on image retrieval and visual commonsense reasoning tasks.
Study systematically analyzes prompt sensitivity of LLMs and proposes robust prompting strategies backed by experiments.
Paper introduces a memory-augmented transformer that improves few-shot learning on in-context learning benchmarks.
Research presents a large-scale evaluation of LLMs on software engineering tasks beyond code completion.
New diffusion-based speech synthesis model achieves human-parity MOS scores on multiple languages.
Paper proposes a learning-to-rank approach for synthetic data generation that improves downstream reasoning accuracy.
Study introduces a new safety benchmark focusing on prompt injection and jailbreak robustness for LLMs.
Research group releases detailed training logs and ablations for a 30B parameter open-source language model.
Paper demonstrates that instruction-tuned models can act as strong reward models for RLHF with reduced human labeling.
New optimization algorithm stabilizes training of extremely deep transformers and shows gains on translation benchmarks.
Study provides a large-scale comparison of quantization methods for efficient LLM inference on edge devices.
Paper presents a unified probabilistic view of diffusion and autoregressive models with empirical validation.
Research releases a large-scale synthetic dataset for program repair and evaluates multiple model families on it.
Paper introduces a benchmark for tool-calling LLMs, covering code execution, web search, and API composition tasks.
New method for multi-step chain-of-thought distillation from large to small models improves sLLM reasoning performance.
Study evaluates different fine-tuning strategies (SFT, DPO, PPO) for alignment and reports comparative results.
Research group open-sources an evaluation suite for robustness of vision models under real-world corruptions.
Paper proposes a framework for measuring and reducing bias in multilingual language models with quantitative metrics.
New retrieval-free factuality objective reduces hallucinations in generation across multiple QA datasets.
Study provides empirical scaling laws for multimodal pretraining across image, text, and audio modalities.
Paper introduces an architecture-agnostic method for curriculum sampling that accelerates LLM pretraining.
Research release: large instruction dataset derived from expert demonstrations with clear licensing and benchmarks.
New work on planning-capable LLM agents shows consistent improvements on navigation and tool-use benchmarks.
Paper presents a rigorous comparison of different long-context mechanisms (ALiBi, RoPE, linear attention) on shared tasks.
Study investigates emergent tool-use behaviors in LLMs and introduces metrics for compositional generalization.
negative_samples: How do I install TensorFlow on Windows?
What is the best online course to learn machine learning as a beginner?
Looking for ML job opportunities in Berlin, any leads?
General Python question: how do I read a CSV file with pandas?
Daily motivation quote: "AI will change the world, keep learning!"
Can someone help me debug this PyTorch shape mismatch error?
We are hiring: Senior Machine Learning Engineer job posting.
Which GPU should I buy for training small models at home?
Is Coursera better than Udemy for AI courses?
